title: CarMax's stock surges after profit and revenue rise above expectations
text: Shares of CarMax Inc. KMX, +3.33% surged 4.1% in premarket trading Tuesday, after the used car retailer reported fiscal second-quarter profit and revenue that rose above expectations amid strength in used vehicle sales. Net income for the quarter to Aug. 31 rose to $233.6 million, or $1.40 a share, from $220.9 million, or $1.24 a share, in the year-ago period. The FactSet consensus for earnings per share was $1.33. Net sales grew 9.1% to $5.20 billion, above the FactSet consensus of $5.05 billion, as used vehicle sales increased 9.3% to $4.35 billion to beat expectations of $4.26 billion. Same-store sales increased 3.2%, just below the FactSet consensus of 3.3%. Used unit sales rose 6.2% to 209,091 vehicles and average used vehicle selling prices grew 2.9% to $20,581. The stock has run up 38.5% year to date through Monday, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.34% has gained 19.3%.
